required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Using Virtual Reality (VR) Models for Robotic Prostatectomy - UNC
clinical_study.official_title: Using Virtual Reality (VR) Models for Robotic Prostatectomy - UNC

brief_summary.textblock: A prospective, randomized, controlled study designed to assess whether digital virtual reality (VR) models, created from existing CT scans and MRIs, provide surgeons with an improved understanding of their patients' anatomy, resulting in more efficient operations (robotic prostatectomy) and improved patient care.

primary_outcome.time_frame: During procedure, not to exceed 12 hours

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured at end of procedure, not to exceed 12 hours

secondary_outcome.measure: Intraoperative conversion from robotic assisted laparoscopic procedure to open procedure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During procedure, not to exceed 12 hours
During procedure, not to exceed 12 hours
Measured at time of patient discharge, up to 10 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Positive tumor margin (assessed via standard post-operative biopsy)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured up to 3 months after discharge
Measured up to 3 months after discharge
Measured up to 6 months after discharge
Measured up to 12 months after disccharge
Measured via survey up to 18 months after discharge
Measured via survey up to 18 months after discharge

arm_group.description: Subjects whose surgeon will be viewing VR models in addition to the source CT/MR image in connection with the case.
Subjects whose surgeon will only be viewing CT/MR images in connection with the case.

intervention.description: VR models generated using Ceevra Reveal are viewed by surgeons in connection with the case in addition to source CT/MR image.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient is undergoing robotic prostatectomy being performed by participating surgeon
- Patient is willing to be randomized between intervention and control arms
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with prior pelvic radiation
- Patients with prior androgen deprivation therapy
- Patients with prior localized ablative therapy
- Patients with prior TURP or other surgical BPH treatment

overall_official.affiliation: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill
